website_summaries.verdict: The Hoka One One Conquest 2 is a stability running shoe that offers a balance of responsive ride and underfoot support. Though most users admired its performance, some were disappointed because of its price, weight, and fit. The Conquest 2 is a good option for runners who are looking for a shoe that has an excellent and responsive performance on the roads.
pros: This shoe features a Lycra ComfortFrame upper for more breathable and stretchable coverage
Many reviewers welcomed the No-sew Construction of the upper, which lets runners experience a sock-like fit
The Conquest 2 uses Rmat High-rebound cushioning technology for rebound and protection against impact forces
The Soft EVA full-length mid-sole works well with the Early Stage Meta-Rocker design, which provides better toe-offs and transitions through the gait cycle
Traction and durable protection are handled by the High Abrasion Lightweight Rubber in the outsole
cons: The Conquest 2 is an expensive running shoe
It has a moderately heavy weight
Some runners observed that the toe box was narrower than the previous version
Limited color options for both men’s and women’s version

customer_reviews.title: great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Really happy to find a pair of the Hoka Conquest. Ths shoe has been discontinued so it was really awesome to find a seller that still had a pair in stock. This is the only shoe that has fit comfortably right out of the box. Nice insoles included and lots of cushion.
customer_reviews.author: R. Camp

customer_reviews.title: I love the style and the support of the Conquest 2
customer_reviews.text: I love the style and the support of the Conquest 2, but Hoka cut down the toe width just enough to cause minor discomfort compared to my previous pair of Conquest shoes. I have long 1'st and 2'nd toes, so I need shoes that are well rounded and not tapered at an angle. I'll ran with them yesterday and will keep them, but slightly disappointed in the size cutback.
customer_reviews.author: George A. Delagardelle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cushioning in Hoka one ones
customer_reviews.text: Awesome cushioning in Hoka one ones. They are light but still large and clumsy while you're running. Definitely a better choice for everyday walking or running long distances at a slower pace. Doesn't feel like a race shoe to me.
customer_reviews.author: Cogmastax

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: The shoes squeak a lot, but other than that quirk, they are wonderful. I have terrible arthritis in my feet and Hokas are the only shoes I can wear anymore (I also have their boots--also very comfortable). There is extra room in the toe boxes of the 2 pair of Hokas I have, which is vital for me.
customer_reviews.author: Judie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and an awesome price on Amazon! Must buy!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes and they are like walking on a cloud... I use them for running and working out at the gym... the only thing I don't use them for is when I teach Zumba and BodyPump... not the right shoes for GroupX... my husband uses them when he takes Turbo Kick, he says he has no problem with them, so to each his own I guess, but I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman with wide feet. (I can wear Vionic sandals in a women's size 9 wide.) As are most Hoka One One shoes on me, I found these to run too narrow and without enough vertical room in the toe box. I wear orthotics, and these shoes did not accommodate them. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Garden Diva

customer_reviews.title: Excellent running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love Hoka one one Conquest. The best running shoes you can get. Compared to the original Conquest, the Conquest 2 are narrower and they fit somewhat smaller. Be sure you get them at least 1/2 number larger (that worked great for me, For the Conquest 2, I use 1/2larger than for the original Conquest). I run ultramarathons and they are great for short and long runs.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: I love Hokas
customer_reviews.text: While these may be running shoes, I walk several miles a week for exercise and find these shoes to be perfect. Have several pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck S.

customer_reviews.title: ... have two other pair of Hokas which are just great. These run 1/2 size too small and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have two other pair of Hokas which are just great. These run 1/2 size too small and the tongue is wide a rubbery and needs to be folded back to put your foot in. Fit2Run doesn't provide return shipping so it cost me almost $20 to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Paulene

customer_reviews.title: fitting good now.
customer_reviews.text: After returning my size ordered, Had to order 1 size larger, still to tight on sides, no problem, put a couple cuts on the rubber border where the laces go through, fitting good now..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE the HOKA sneakers
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my HOKA sneakers! They are very comfortable, light in weight, good foot support, and fun to wear. This is my second pair, and I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Great for daily road running
customer_reviews.text: Great for daily road running. Lots of cushion, feel great, terrific support on feet, legs, knees, and joints! I love these running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Wish they had the no-tie shoestrings like my previous Hokas but otherwise great.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: This is my go-to shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to shoe. I had constant metatarsal pain until I switched to these shoes. The last pair I used lasted over 600 miles before I felt the first signs that they were giving out.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher D Oubre

customer_reviews.title: What a great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: What a great shoe!!! Because of the awesome cushion I haven't had any knee or ankle pain! I may be converted to Hoka.
customer_reviews.author: Paul McIsaac

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorites! My feet never get tired in them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: still breaking them in. Get a lot of compliments ...
customer_reviews.text: still breaking them in. Get a lot of compliments on the color and looks!
customer_reviews.author: Ces Lawton

customer_reviews.title: Hoka's are the best running shoe I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Hoka's are the best running shoe I have ever owned. I feel like they have shock absorbers ad at my age, it is exactly what my joints need.
customer_reviews.author: ama

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable cushioning wise
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable cushioning wise. Just a tad narrow in toes. Comfortable, more than a couple of hours, but not for 10.
customer_reviews.author: G. Finlay

customer_reviews.title: Super cushioning. Ran 9 miles right out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Super cushioning. Ran 9 miles right out of the box. Felt great. My third pair of Hokas. Do yourself a favor. Get a pair
customer_reviews.author: Troy H Dillard

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. This is my second identical pair because ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. This is my second identical pair because I wear them daily. Great for your back, feet and legs. Very light and lots of cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Another convert
customer_reviews.text: May be too soft for others but I love them. Tom
customer_reviews.author: T. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe for me.
customer_reviews.text: I only wear them to run. The shoe performs as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Conquest is my shoe. Tried others that didn't fit me as well
customer_reviews.author: Bob Beckemeyer

customer_reviews.title: great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe if you like comfort and stability. They just feel good.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Bleier

customer_reviews.title: better than expected
customer_reviews.text: first time I have run for over a year. gives me confidence and support.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my son at Christmas. He's a runner and absolutely loves them
customer_reviews.author: Hockey Mom 16

customer_reviews.title: Zero pain and fatigue!
customer_reviews.text: I noticed both young men who were our caddies at a golf resort were wearing the different shoes with a larger sole. They raved about being able to caddy for 36 holes a day with zero foot pain. I was struggling with another brand making my feet hurt on 1-2 mile walks. I got online and found these Hokas in Seahawks colors. Just returned from NYC where we walked for 5 days all over the city. Zero pain, amazing comfort and good looking too. Will definitely buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Miller

customer_reviews.title: I ran a few short runs in these and didn't like the tightness on my toes
customer_reviews.text: I ran through two pairs ofHoka Conquests, and was excited for the Comquest 2. This shoe is very narrow in the toe box. I ran a few short runs in these and didn't like the tightness on my toes, and my one foot was tingling from the sung fit. This will be fine for a kick around shoes, but unfortunately not running.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W. McDonough

customer_reviews.title: The hoka one one is perfect. This is my second pair
customer_reviews.text: Since I have a foot problems (Neuropathy) and work at a high school, on my feet most of the day. The hoka one one is perfect. This is my second pair. If they made it in different widths, that would make it even better.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Patton

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoe, hate the tongue!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED this shoe originally. Very comfortable, easy to run in. Here is my complaint, I hate the tongue! It slides around and bunches up... I ran a half marathon yesterday (prep race for Boston in April), had to stop three times to adjust. I'll keep these for training runs but going to the Bondi 4, with the old fashioned tongue, for long distance. Overall I love this shoe. As I do with all my shoes, I install my own insert to deal with my plantar fasciitis. This shoe is so comfortable, just hate the moving tongue! :)
customer_reviews.author: johndfffff

customer_reviews.title: Hooka for running and walking.
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of Hooka running shoes and they are the best to run in. The next best part of getting new Hookas to run in is that I now use my old pair for everyday use and they are the best to walk in too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great cushioning for walking or running. Amazing feel on uneven terrain and the pavement. Somewhat narrow but it may be due to my use of orthotics.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Keith

customer_reviews.title: and this is by far the best shoe I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Have had multiple running shoes throughout the years, and this is by far the best shoe I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Best there is
customer_reviews.text: Hook's are great. Totally got rid of my plantar fasciitis. i wouldn't do our walk/run without them.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny Eiger

customer_reviews.title: The concept 2 is a good shoe but not for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 pair of conquest. I saw a review on the conquest 2 which said the conquest 2 was even more stable. It is not. The concept 2 is a good shoe but not for my purposes. I supinated from day one and do not with the original conquest.
customer_reviews.author: Putter

customer_reviews.title: I like them very much so far
customer_reviews.text: I like them very much so far. I do agree the tongue is skimpy, but does not detract from performance with which I am very pleased. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Damien Brouillard

customer_reviews.title: Quality Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This is the Cadillac of the Clifton/Odyssey lines. It is a bit heavier and slightly less cushioned (more responsive sole material), but the quality and comfort is definitely there. I can understand the negative reviews out there, but it depends on your previous experiences with Hoka, as well as the specific shoes you prefer.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: You might be an odd duck on the pavements, but little by little everyone start following it. Hoka is the next thing!
customer_reviews.text: Changed the way I run. hard to explain until you try it. Its the safest thing you can have for your knee while having better performance. I literally waiting for my next run to come with those. You are odd duck on the pavements, but little by little everyone following it. Hoka is the next thing!
customer_reviews.author: Eli.M

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe but wish they had the same shoelaces as the first one, but I guess there were a lot of complaints.
customer_reviews.author: tenny321

product_meta.title: HOKA ONE ONE mens Conquest 2
product_meta.description: Hoka Conquest 2 CONQUER YOUR QUEST Known for its stability, the Conquest 2 features the right blend of technologies, implemented to improve balance and control. Lyrca ComfortFrame Upper. For 2016, the Conquest 2 receives an update upper, with a focus on lightweight comfort. Implementing a protective single mesh construction allows air to permeate the shoe, generating an environment that is both cool and dry. Consisting of a full Lyrca ComfortFrame utilising lycra fibres, enables the shoe to possess excellent stretch and recovery measures. This inclusion allows the shoes to conform to all aspects of the feet whilst maintaining shape once inactive. Hoka infuse seamless supportive overlays which provide necessary stabilisation around the midfoot from medial to lateral. A seamless interior environment to the Valor reduces irritation and blistering, as well as the number of potential weak points throughout the shoe that would otherwise be prone to tearing or breakage. A softer, lightly padded tongue merged onto the upper provides increased protection and comfort across the foot. Full Length CMEVA Midsole. The Conquest utilises two technologies within the midsole: full length CMEVA, provides industry leading cushioning for increased impact protection and stability. Add to that R-MAT and this technology works diligently to further increase cushioning, whilst remaining dully resilient. Specifically engineered with a low heel-toe differential and a sculpted outsole radius, the Conquest delivers a more responsive ride without sacrificing its well accustomed cushioning properties. Hoka shoes offer a unique rolling motion for the most natural, efficient and effortless stride. To achieve these results this has an extended profile; a logarithmic shape for a smooth progressive rolling motion. There is unsurpassed shock attenuation, a sense of weightlessness and an inherently stable ride which is designed to reduce the fatigue in your feet, legs and core. R-MAT Grip Outsole. The
feature_bullets: Protective Single Mesh Upper - Promotes breathability, ensuring air can reach all confinements of the feet.
Full Lyrca ComfortFrame - Possess excellent stretch and recovery properties for additional durability and sock-like feel.
Seamless Supportive Overlays - Provide security around the midfoot whilst simultaneously reducing weight.
Traditional Lacing System - Increases the fit of the shoe promoting a more secure fit.

Early Stage Meta-Rocker Geometry - Specifically engineered with a low heel-toe differential and a sculpted outsole radius in the heel and toe, encourages a guided foot gait cycle; supports a runner's form and running mechanics.
